title: [AD Support Item Line] Courtier's Crossbow
body:
*"The Shield to guard you from harm, the Spellblade to strike at your foes, the Talisman to guide you to safety, and the Crossbow to do your will in the shadows."*

In an attempt to expand the current support meta, I bring you a proposal for a line of items for AD-based supports.

**Colour Scheme:** Red, in order to match the blue, yellow and green of the other support items.
**Theme:** As the Relic Shield line is based off Mount Targon, the Ancient Coin line is based off the Shurima Desert and the Spellthief's Edge line is based off the Freljord, the Courtier's Crossbow is based off the city states themselves. This line follows the aesthetics of courtly intrigue and the danger that lurks in a city.

**Tier 1:** Courtier's Crossbow.

*Cost:* 365 gold.

*Benefits:* 
+5 Attack Damage.
UNIQUE PASSIVE - OPPORTUNITY: Your next damaging ability or autoattack against a champion will grant 8 gold provided there is an allied champion within 1000 units of you. You generate one charge of Opportunity every 10 seconds, storing up to 5. Killing a minion disables this passive (and the charge generation) for 12 seconds.
You may only be in possession of 1 Gold Income item.

*Gold Efficiency:* 49.315%

**Tier 2:** Arbalest.

*Cost:* 865 gold.
*Builds From:* Courtier's Crossbow.

*Benefits:*
+15 Attack Damage.
+5% Cooldown Reduction.
UNIQUE PASSIVE - OPPORTUNITY: Your next damaging ability or autoattack against a champion will grant 12 gold provided there is an allied champion within 1000 units of you. You generate one charge of Opportunity every 10 seconds, storing up to 5. Killing a minion disables this passive (and the charge generation) for 12 seconds.
You may only be in possession of 1 Gold Income item.

*Gold Efficiency:* 80.73%

**Tier 3:** Spymaster's Tutelage.

*Cost:* 2200 gold.
*Builds From:* Arbalest + Long Sword + Long Sword.

*Benefits:*
+50 Attack Damage.
+10% Cooldown Reduction.
UNIQUE PASSIVE - OPPORTUNITY: Your next damaging ability or autoattack against a champion will grant 12 gold provided there is an allied champion within 1000 units of you. You generate one charge of Opportunity every 10 seconds, storing up to 5.
You may only be in possession of 1 Gold Income item.
UNIQUE ACTIVE - BOLT OF DARKNESS: Fire a bolt of shadows that detonates at target location. Enemies caught in the area are blinded for 1 second, and their armour is reduced by 20%. The armour reduction effect decays over 2 seconds. 60 seconds cooldown (850 range, 250 radius).

*Gold Efficiency:* 96.21%.

-*-

Potential champions who may use this item: Ashe, Ezreal, Caitlyn, Jinx, Pantheon, Xin Zhao, Jarvan IV, Gnar, Lee Sin, Aatrox, AD Blitzcrank, Vi, Riven, Poppy, Jax.

-*-

*Rationale:* This item is inspired by the Frost Queen's Claim line. The passive was lifted from Spellthief's Edge with a few modifications:

* It does not grant passive gold, so the gold per proc needs to be higher. This means that AD supports need to be aggressive in order to earn gold, which allows opponents the opportunity to counterplay and turn a trade around.
* It does not add increased damage per proc, given that AD champions often do well enough damage on their own.
* It does not proc off structures, since AD champions have an easier time taking down towers than their AP equvalents, and therefore need no further encouragement to do so. This is also why I took the number of charges from 3 to 5.
* It requires an allied champion within 1000 units in order to discourage mid-game split-pushing (which AD champions are rather good at).

The stats given are geared towards maximising the damage output of the AD support, and the active is particularly good on auto-attack heavy teams but works adequately to give ADCs a boost regardless of team composition.

Addition: It's been raised as a concern that the visuals on armour shred may be unclear. The way I envision the active on this item is a lance of thick shadow that explodes into a smokescreen-like burst of darkness. The smokescreen lasts for 1 second (the same duration as the blind). The armour shred could be represented as tendrils of shadow clinging to the champions affected. The full armour shred would be represented as a thick shroud that slowly fades away until it disappears entirely. Further discussion on the visual clarity of resistance shreds can be found [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay/I6NAkeor-visual-clarity-resistance-shred).

-*-

Comments and criticism welcome!

replies.body:
I love the idea--AD supports are intriguing.  In my experience, Zeke's and FQC are main items (esp on Ashe support!), but I feel the stats on FQC is wasted on a lot of AD supports (Darius, Blitz, Thresh, Pantheon, J4, etc).

That said, the attack speed active is a little lackluster for me. Given FQC has one of my favorite actives in the game, I'd love to see a new thing created for AD supps--maybe upon activation, Courtier's increases attack speed and stuns the first target attacked (for a short duration, like .5 sec) by each ally within range of Courtier's active.  Something nifty like that to help you use that darn attack speed! 

Though I am hesitant to use something like atkspd on an active like that since typically support item actives are useful for teamfighting and laning, not taking towers/objectives, which atkspd would be super useful for.  Perhaps the stun and maybe a burning shield or maybe movespeed stealing?

Thank you for the reply!

I have to agree that the active is rather lackluster (FQC's active is one of my faves as well), but I was trying to go for practical over elaborate.

What would you think of this:

"UNIQUE ACTIVE - BOLT OF DARKNESS: Fire a bolt of shadows that detonates at target location. Enemies caught in the area are blinded, and their armour is reduced by 20%, this effect decays over 2 seconds. 60 seconds cooldown (850 range, 250 radius)."

This neatly counters the main problem of AD support (enemies stacking armour), and provides a specific strength against autoattack-heavy champs, while being mostly useless against casters.
Oooh, I like the Bolt of Darkness.  It's thematically sound (a crossbow bolt in the darkness).  #rektm8
Thank you! I've changed the active. I am really grateful for the help!

I like this too, for a couple reasons:

- As an AD item, it feels more impactful
  - AS isn't useful on Xerath
- It's more in line with the other offensive support item
- It more in line with building from a brutalizer (let's be honest, the build path basically includes a brut)

Can I suggest that it also has a very small knockback attached? I'm thinking draven-size, with NO slow afterward.

My problem with a knockback is that's it hard cc, and therefore interrupts channels and can cancel powerful ultimates like Caitlyn's and Fiddlesticks'. It's far too powerful for an item to simply release like that (it'd become practically mandatory for any matchup reliant on channeling, like Caitlyn/Fiddlesticks bot lane, for example).

Fair enough. My thought was, a 2 second, decaying armor shred isn't going to do that much for your team. What's that, 1-4 autos  (depending on stage of the game) before the shred is negligible? And that's assuming you're in range to follow up. It would be useful when paired with bursty adcs like graves or lucian, to maximize their ult damage, but rather useless in soloQ, where people aren't that coordinated.

Having a small knockback would give your team time to engage while the armor shred is up.

What if you changed the knockback to a short (.25 sec) root, and made the armor shred flat, or starting small and ramping up over two seconds?

Also, forgot to mention these would be instead of the blind.

What if your team can't make use of the 3 secs of movespeed given by Talisman? Or the 2 secs of slow brought by FQC? Or the shield from Face of the Mountain? All support actives need a modicum of judgement and team coordination, and this is no different.

I feel that this item is much like Exhaust. You don't use it when the enemy is coming in or running away, you use it when the enemy is already committed to a fight, when the enemy is at its peak of power, and you can reduce it or nullify it. Like I said before, if you want a chasing item, Frost Queen's Claim or Talisman is more your thing. Much like Face of the Mountain, this item is for the thick of a fight, when your ADC is *already* autoattacking the enemy, and you need to swing that trade in your ADC's favour (ideally, you want to apply Black Cleaver stacks first and *then* this item, in order to maximise your ADC's damage on them).

As for the snare, I am loath to apply any form of movement cc on this item (not to mention that roots and snares can interrupt dashes, blinks and jumps in mid-casting), given that I want Frost Queen's Claim to remain useful in its own way, so that each support item has its own specialty. What's the point of Frost Queen's Claim if this item also has some form of movement impairing AND an armour shred?

OK, fair enough, you've convinced me. I'm still concerned that the armor shred is too short/weak (consider that FQC slow is 80, decaying), though.

As an aside, armor shred needs to have a better visual indicator.

I like the idea but 2 seconds blind is way too OP.
{{champion:133}} demands a buff if this goes Live.
It's on a 60 sec cooldown though. Quinn can spam her blind far more often. In fact, Quinn support with this item can let her ADC pummel auto-attack-heavy team comps.

That's true. But I still think that **blind** is very powerful. Right now it's limited to a few champions but if *everyone* can get it...

Another thought: How do you think this item (active) will affect Melee Carries?

It's not really everyone, it's limited to AD supports, which can take advantage of the blind in an auto-attack trade.

What do you mean? I count melee AD carries as AD supports for the purposes of this item, so everything I said stands for them as well. If you're worried that solo laners are going to buy this item for the two second blind, well... the item is never fully gold efficient, and the first two tiers are absolutely awful gold-wise (not to mention their gold-giving passive flat out does not work in a solo lane). If a solo laner is willing to sink 2.2K gold for +50 AD, 10% cooldown reduction and a 2 sec blind and armour reduction on a skill shot that they can miss... well, let me just say that there are better itemisation choices. Last Whisper and Black Cleaver ignore a higher percentage of armour than this, and the blind is not terribly powerful for its cost, particularly when you can still be destroyed by abilities.

At the end of the day, I don't worry overmuch. Blind is one of the softest forms of CC, and for the price you're paying here, plus the need to aim the skillshot, it becomes a very gimmicky build in the hands of an AD solo laner. Once the opponent is aware of what you're trying to do, they can easily bait the item's active and then kill you in the 60 second cooldown.

It's most effective on AD Supports but not limited to them. Other supports can get this item as well. I think making the enemy ADC useless for 2 second is very much worth the buy.

The ADCs may also choose to rush this item. It costs 650G more than B.F. Sword but comes with 10% CDR, 2s blind, armor reduction and gold generation. That's a lot of power early game. If you can bait the enemy into combat, getting a kill or two might be possible. If you can't,...

Considering the 96.21% Gold Efficiency and the low cost, I wouldn't say that solo laners won't buy it. If I'm up against Jax, I might bought it.

The thing about Melee Carries is that they're very weak to CC. I think adding 2s blind into the game will make them even less viable than right now.

Here's the thing though, *many* things make the enemy adc useless for 2 seconds (or more), including Frost Queen's Claim's active. The entire point of support actives is either turning around an initiation or maximising your initiation potential.

I'll reduce the blind to 1 second, if only to prevent solo laner abuse.

Well, FQC is slow so they still have the choice to stay and fight. If you're blinded the only option is run (unless you're an AD Caster).

1 second seems fair though.

Thanks for listening to my ramble. Great idea you have there.

Yeah, and that's sort of what makes FQC different from this. FQC is not defensive at all, it's a chasing tool (either to chase or to slow down people chasing you). This item is a fighting tool, either to initiate on an adc/bruiser or to counter his initiation. Variety! Diversity!

No problem! Thanks for the feedback!

oh man, I really want to play Ashe support now. I wonder if coin might be better on Ashe? She doesn't use AP for anything till lvl 6, and the extra mobility with talisman may be helpful on Ashe (she gets free crits on her autos anyways, so I don't know if constantly harassing or just waiting till passive is up and attacking would be more or less efficient?).

EDIT: Progress report on Ashe support: only played [one game](http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1493429260/203721172), early game was brutal for the other bot lane (granted Vayne/Braum isn't the best against poke bot lanes), I personally played really poorly mid game, but late game teamfights were really fun; I did as much damage to champions as their ADC/Top. Zeke's + Talisman (or other support item) + 10% CDR from masteries means ECA is up so often, it's hilarious (I also stole dragon with it XD). I think Talisman works well since the combination of Volley + Talisman means your whole team can kite/engage rather easily. You also just shred through objectives with your team, especially with Zeke's. Not sure how her other match ups go but I feel like I'm going to be playing a lot more support Ashe XD

Thanks for the report! Support Ashe is a thing that definitely works, and it would be interesting to compare/contrast Talisman!Ashe vs. Crossbow!Ashe if this item ever makes it to the game. While Talisman has better kiting/engage/disengage potential, Crossbow has a lot more offensive power and can put a lot of pressure in a lane (and potentially aid hypercarry ADCs to snowball faster).

Yea, I had to fight the urge to get a DBlade start game just for the extra harass potential instead of coin/spellthief's. I think talisman is sort of the best option for her out of the current items (you already basically have an AoE slow every two seconds with Volley + 40% CDR, and she doesn't need the AP until lvl 6 anyways, so it feels like a waste. You'll do a bit less harass vs. Spellthief's early, but you still do a ton of damage and can really zone out lanes with shorter range than you). Talisman Ashe is more useful for the utility, but I feel like Crossbow Ashe will be more of a threat; I'd really like to be able to try it out :D

Yeah, that's exactly what I think. I feel Spellthief is highly wasted on AD supports that want to poke and harass, and yet it's the closest equivalent you have.

I feel it depends on team comp. A high damage team will benefit more from Talisman Ashe, while a high-cc, low-damage team will want Crossbow Ashe early game to apply pressure in bot lane.

On one hand, I really would like the extra damage on crossbow, but I did like the mana regen on talisman allowing me to spam Volley without worrying about saving mana for ult. I think crossbow would have higher gold generation, so a bit of mana regen would be easy to pick up too (I imagine Tear would be the best pick up here, since you can build into Manamune if it gets to late game. I don't think I'd get Mikael's since I would be overcapping on CDR with Crossbow, Zeke's, and masteries). Having combat stats on a support item too would allow you to put off zeke's for damage a bit too. I think crossbow would be, in most cases, the better option; boots of mobility would probably be more than enough to get around quickly, not to mention Zeal is a good intermediate item on Ashe (for the attack speed and crit chance).

What I just realized, and I like a lot, is that with the new AP top lane meta (Maokai/Gragas/Nidalee still does magic damage with her spells/Lulu, etc.), there's more room for AD champions in a team composition; since we already have champions like Zyra and Annie in support that provide a ton of magic damage, now you can have a legitimate AD threat as a support with Ashe/Gangplank/Poppy/other AD supports (the pool will really open up now that there's a legitimate option for AD supports).

The mana problem could be easily fixed with a Frozen Heart (which also gives you armour and cooldown reduction, though you might be overcapping the CDR with masteries).

That's the idea! And even if you don't have those AP tops, you still have beasts like Teemo, Heimerdinger and Kayle making regular appearances in top lane, which allow your team to go for a physical-damage support to avoid being easy to itemise against.

Right, the trouble with support is that you have so many CDR options; I would probably prefer Zeke's over Frozen Heart (Ashe typically doesn't have the HP to make great use of armor). I think Tear would be more than enough, actually preferable since it is cheap and gives her a good amount of regen plus extra mana as the game progresses (and she can stack it pretty quick with her Q). I would probably just leave it at Tear until late game, since I'd want to prioritize attack speed and crit chance next on Ashe, but Manamune theoretically doesn't seem like a bad item on support Ashe (or you can build Archangel's for stronger ECAs, or sell it for another regen item for even more AP).

Not to mention Ryze and Mundo deal a lot of magic damage :D

Just wondering, have you thought of adding a passive gold generation to Crossbow like the Spellthief line has? I'm just thinking; most supports who take FQC are ranged; I guess you could argue that melee supports will want Targon's anyways, but if a melee support has good early game damage, say Pantheon, and would rather build damage (since he already has his passive to mitigate a lot of damage), it would be difficult for them to use the stacks since they're inherently zoned due to the lack of range. Maybe if you lower the gold generation on proc and add some GP10? Just so it's a little more forgiving if you're completely zoned and can't proc the stacks. Just a thought, not sure if it's a good idea.
Thank you so much for posting this game.  You should try going Manamune first and post that as well :D

Haha, take that game with a grain of salt; just a single team builder normal with a very favorable match up, but I think it's a decent representation of an average game.

Honestly though, I think Ashe is going to be my go-to poke support; I really haven't had much success with the new Sona or Karma as support. You can do similar if not greater burst damage with a Volley + Crit, plus you have greater sustained poke with your autos. Your ult too is fairly similar to Sona's, as a fairly large AoE CC, but it's also global compared to the relatively short range of Sona's ult. Hawkshot is basically blue trinket; you basically have two trinkets, which is freaking awesome.

It's hard to say about the Manamune build; I was only suggesting Tear as a replacement for the mana regen on Talisman. I would probably only build Manamune if Crossbow was implemented in the game, and as a later/last item if that (I would try to get Tear as soon as I thought I needed mana, but leave it at that till later). I think if I had more gold in that game, I would have worked towards a Stattik Shiv/Phantom Dancer (or more likely a tank item, since their carries were pretty fed), since attack speed, crit chance, and mobility are so important on Ashe.

Well that's the thing, getting a pokey support that can also help push a lane isn't a commonly used combination.  Most teams just opt for the "let the ADC push and we'll get ganks every now and then" strategy, at least in my experience.  I'm in agreement regarding the ult and E -- so clutch!

Hmm, alright.  The only "tank" items I've ever thrown on Ashe are Banshee's and Guardian, or were you referring to something like Last Whisper?  

In regards to the other items, I'm just trying to understand the usability of Manamune upon its transformation to Muramana in favor of the items you mentioned, because even in a support role I'd still lean towards what you mentioned.

idk, I feel like with Ashe you can put a lot more objective pressure on because you can push a lane and also shred through turrets and dragon. I'm not really pushing lane either, mostly just harassing the living bejesus out of my lane opponent.

yea I was thinking Banshee's or GA, maybe Locket if no one else is getting it. Either that or Frozen Mallet for the HP.

Manamune is more just a consequence of playing with the Crossbow concept item and buying Tear for mana regen; If you build Talisman you really have no need for extra mana regen. I personally like to harass a lot with W and not have to worry about having mana for R, I would prioritize every other item first, but if it's super late game and I don't need to sell Tear for like, Mikael's or something, then I would build a Manamune.

I agree with most of this!  I think an item like this would have a lot of synergy with Zeke's, which is an interesting item that I rarely see anymore.  

Only thing you're forgetting about is Ardent Censer.  That's a totally awesome AP support item that can grant massive attack speed boosts to multiple allies in the right hands (e.g., Sona, or Karma).  I have used it to great effect when taking objectives and towers, as well as in team fights.  However, I agree with the idea that there are many possible ways an item like this could be implemented.  

The only thing left to do is test it out Riot!

as much as I want an ad support item to happen, it really cant :( what is to stop an adc from getting this item. it is the same dilemma relic shield had when it first went live. Both laners would get the gold generating item and snowball ahead.

What I want to see right now is the frost queens claim item lines passive to proc off of gangplanks passives magic damage. I dont get why it doesnt when brands passive which is also a dot triggers it.

Ummmm... forgive me for asking, but did you read the passive? A) It requires an allied champion to get the extra gold (it's worthless for solo laners). B) The gold-generating passive gets disabled if you kill a minion (unless you buy the last tier). C) Without the passive, it's a horrendously gold-inefficient item that provides nothing but situational benefits. If you want armour reduction, get Black Cleaver or Last Whisper. It's like an AP mid getting Frost Queen's Claim for the 80% slow active.

I did not forget to read the passive, and my comment did not refer to top laners as they do not use support items. I am saying what is to stop a double adc lane where they both take the item and trade off between csing and harassing. both receive gold efficiently and will be able to build into the late game. The item also only benefits ranged ad champions. Its final item stats are favorable enough to build even in solo lanes for the active alone. those situational benefits easily turn a duel.

It's not gold efficient. The passive deactivates for 12 seconds if you kill a minion, and you only gain charges every 10 seconds. Note that you do not gain charges while the passive is deactivated (I didn't feel like I had to clarify this because this is how Spellthief's Edge works). Alternating between csing and harassing is mathematically inefficient. You will end up with two underfarmed ADCs who are occupying ~17% of their inventory space with a gold inefficient item.

A 1 second blind is useless if the enemy spams their abilities on you instead of autoattacking. Oh no, you blinded Caitlyn, she just throws a Q at you and still deals damage through the blind. Every single AD champion has at least one ability they can use while they're blinded to deal damage (except perhaps Vayne, if you've already baited her Condemn, or Jax, if you baited his stun. Yi simply heals up through the blind and then Qs you again). Blinding full-on AD casters like Pantheon is useless, and tanky ADs can just weather it.

As I explained to another poster: the armour shred is deceptive. Enemies not stacking armour will get a 5-8 armour reduction (practically meaningless late game), and while it does have an optimal effect on enemies who ARE stacking armour, it's a decaying effect. This item doesn't perform well in solo trades, the math just doesn't back up those fears.

My suggestions:

- Going from Arbalest to Tutelage, no change in gold generation.
  - Keep the item in line with other support items
- Remove the lifesteal
  - A support isn't going to deal enough damage to get much from lifesteal, anyway.
  - If you want to add on sustain, give it life on-hit (old doran's passive)
  - If you want to give it more poke, just increase the AD (and build out of a Pickaxe)
- Remove the lifesteal from the active
  - It's largely invisible power; it won't feel as good to use, and your allies won't notice how much it's helping them
  - Instead, just increase the AS boost, or give all nearby allies some on-hit damage (like a sona Q aura).

* There is no change in gold generation between Arbalest and Tutelage. Where do you see it? The only change is the removal of the "killing minions disables this", which is also what happens between Frostfang and Frost Queen's Claim.
* Can't really remove the lifesteal, since it builds off Vamp Scepter (the only item in the ~800 gold range that made sense, given that Avarice Blade was even worse for a support). I was thinking of building it off pickaxe, but it breaks the rule of building off an advanced item (like Kindle Gem, Forbidden Idol and Fiendish Codex). I'll give it some more thought and get back to you.
* That's something I can't argue about. I was originally just gonna have it be a flat aspeed increase, but I felt I had to justify the vamp scepter more. I'll definitely change that.


EDIT: Decided to go for the Pickaxe. If in the future there is an advanced AD item on the ~800 gold range that is good for a support, I'll replace it for the Pickaxe.

What if it built from a brutalizer, and had some kind of armor-reducing passive (either BC, or Wits End for armor)?

- It would be in line with other support items building from T2 items.
  - Specifically, T2 items with 10% cdr.
- It would be useful for a support, because you'd amplify your adc's damage if you're focusing the same target.
- It would synnergize well with the AS active.

Brutalizer would be absolutely ideal, but it costs 1337 gold, which puts the item's total cost above 2200, which is what all the other support items cost. I wish there was a workaround, but I just can't see it. Unless they decrease brutalizer's cost (and they won't, because it's an in-joke), it just can't be part of a support item, no matter how good it is.

On the other hand, it leaves Black Cleaver as a perfect itemisation item for AD supports.

You could keep it pretty dang close:

>Arbalest + Brutalizer + 20 gold = Spymaster's Tutelage (2222 gold)

It would, however, suffer from "Triforce Syndrome," where nobody would ever end up sitting on a brutalizer, so you might as well make it build from 2 longswords at that point.

Yeah, I feel that Pickaxe is not ideal (vamp scepter in that regard is nicer because it can be bought in two discrete chunks) but it's not as expensive/unwieldy as Brutalizer.

And like I said, I want to add to AD Support itemisation, rather than detract from it, so leaving Brutalizer out of this item line allows for the kind of variety that is sorely needed.

True. You could do this, though:

>Arbalest + LS + LS + Gold = Spymaster's Tutelage

A little unconventional, but not terrible.

And, let's not forget, this means a support can build 5 longswords and have them all build into something useful :D

That alone makes it worth.

Hmmmmm. That's actually true. And a lot more manageable on a support's budget, rather than having to wait for a full pickaxe (even if the pickaxe is more gold efficient).

All right, I made the change. Hopefully it will make the thread get less downvotes. Didn't know people were so against AD supports. :(

>Didn't know people were so against AD supports.

Well, I think AD supports have a fundamental issue right now, which is this:

>Supports are useful either for CC or because they have good base damage, so they don't need much gold.

>If you don't give a support champ one or both of these things, they do not make a good support.

Let's break this into two categories, melee and ranged.

>#Melee

They'd pretty much always rather build tank. Whether they have good bases or cc, they need to get in the enemy's face to use it, and they're not going to make it there without some tankiness. Plus, they get the execute on Relic Shield, which also gives them sustain, so they'd rather use that.

>#Ranged

The issue here is that all ranged AD's scale really well, because of the way that AD scaling works (multiplicative with AD/AS/Crit). So they suffer from "the lulu issue." If you give them good enough cc and/or bases to be useful in a duo lane, without farm, they just go to a solo lane, bully the crap out of the other laner, and then scale super well, too. So these champs don't really need an AD support item, because they'd rather be farming.

I like this, even if I don't play Ad supports.
One thing to ask. Could Brutalizer fit in somehow? It would make sense, more CDR, and the Pen from the bolt of shadows. I get that that would make the cost really high. However, you're getting 8 gold an auto. Tis alot. You'd get a ton of gold early, which would help. However, this item has absolutely NO regen at all. None. If you're an AD support, and you buy this item, you're going to be poking a ton. Most AD supports are melee, so you'll be taking a lot of harass while trying to get close enough to hit. Maybe add a little lifesteal 2nd level instead of CDR? Some AD supports, Ashe, Ezreal, etc., don't need it. Food for thought.
This item would make support Wukong amazing.

I actually didn't want to include Brutaliser in the recipe for this one because I expected Black Cleaver to be a core item on AD supports, so you're already buying a Brutaliser and I wanted to diversify item building options.

My first draft of the item had a vampiric scepter as a component, and people didn't like it (switch to chronological view on this thread and check out the first few replies), so I changed it up. Lifesteal is one of those things that is best the more AD and AS you have (which is hard to get on a support's budget, even with this item's generous amounts of GP5), and the more often you are autoattacking, which is not something that is guaranteed to happen.

I considered adding some form of sustain mechanic, but it felt like it eclipsed the Relic Shield line (and to a lesser extent, the Ancient Coin line). I feel that, just like Spellthief's Edge doesn't have any in-built sustain, this item shouldn't have it either. If you're a melee AD support, it's the strategic choice you have to make: do I go for the tankiness and sustain or the raw AD power? It might depend on who you're laning against, too. If you're going to be facing a lot of range and poke (like a Caitlyn/Zyra lane), you might want to go for Relic Shield, while a less pokey lane might merit this item instead.

Thanks for the reply though!

I am extremely wary of touching regen (mana or HP), because of the latest changes in those stats. I am not sure where things will be going and how will regen items will be impacted, so I'd rather not get into something that may be rendered completely irrelevant come next patch.

All support items have CDR because it's the most important stat for a support and a common theme in all the GP5 support items, so I didn't want to break away from that tradition. I can't really get rid of the CDR or else it just won't fit with the rest of the items on the line. It's not strange to get CDR without mana regen, it's on the Face of the Mountain (and Kindlegem) and it hasn't destroyed anybody's builds.

I feel that adding more stats to the item would put it into potentially dangerous positions, given that AD champions tend to be oriented towards significant damage, and that's somewhat unhealthy for supports (Annie got her base damage nerfed earlier this season when she surfaced as a strong support pick in competitive play).

I appreciate the suggestions, but I am pretty happy with the way the item looks now, at least with regards to the passive stats. If you want to help, you could get a Rioter to give it a look! :D

The reason I named it alliance was to reference the fact that it's a support item, that it requires to be near an allied champion, and to evoke the theme of shadowy confabulations behind locked doors. The idea was to evoke a sense of city intrigue and "supportiness", so I felt alliance was a way to convey that. The feeling I wanted to evoke was that you were a courtier/spymaster sniping people from afar (or weaving in and out of the ~~shadows~~ tall brush as you harry your enemies).

I guess that the idea is to emphasise that even shady people are capable of profound loyalty. The idea is that you, the AD support, are the Spymaster, and you become the tutor to your ADC, tending him like a flower in a garden, pruning the weeds and tearing out the insects that wish to devour him, so that he may bloom into a late-game carry. You are the wise mentor, taking out threats and keeping them off your charge, so that he may grow strong under your, well, tutelage. :D

Does that make the term Alliance make more sense? Or do you have a better suggestion that fits with the theme I want to evoke?
